title: Current± Predicts: The energy transition in 2021, part one
lead: Part one of Current±'s annual predictions series is kicked off by Flexitricity's Alastair Martin and Arenko's Andy Hadland, offering their thoughts on what 2021 has in store for the energy transition.
author: Current± Staff

title: UKPN settles into new, energy efficient home
lead: ​UK Power Networks (UKPN) has moved into what it has dubbed its most energy efficient office ever.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: EDF launches its cheapest EV tariff under GoElectric umbrella
lead: EDF has launched its cheapest electric vehicle (EV) tariff to date to help make it easier and cheaper for drivers to switch.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Centrica and unions take significant step in controversial contract negotiation
lead: ​A significant step has been made by Centrica and unions, with the majority of workers accepting new contract terms.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: ‘Critical role’ of energy storage in future UK energy system detailed in 15-year roadmap
lead: ​A roadmap for energy storage has been launched by researchers at the University of Birmingham in an effort to detail its role in the energy system over the next 10-15 years.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Energy sector praises CCC 78% GHG reduction ambition, but calls for more details for next steps
lead: The CCC's landmark report has been broadly welcomed by the energy sector, who told Current± they commended the ambition but more concrete guidance is still needed for the sector.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Rapid charging lauded as public preference as Osprey unveils 100th EV charging site in Marstons rollout
lead: ​Osprey has completed the 100th rapid electric vehicle (EV) charging site as part of its deal with Marstons as the duo unveil new consumer research.
author: Alice Grundy

title: CCC releases ‘ambitious, realistic and affordable’ route to a fully decarbonised nation
lead: The Climate Change Committee (CCC) has laid out a route to a fully decarbonised UK, it what it is calling a world first.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Centrica strikes deal with Alfen for EV charging infrastructure
lead: ​Centrica has signed a three-year framework with Alfen to supply electric vehicle (EV) chargers to British Gas engineers and Centrica sites.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Good Energy calls on Ofgem to stop ‘consumers being sold down the river’ with greenwashing
lead: ​Good Energy has called on Ofgem to update the licensing condition to reinstate the link between Power Purchase Agreements (PPAs) and customers to tackle greenwashing.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Ofgem ramps up RIIO-2 funding to £40bn in final determination
lead: ​Ofgem has upped the funding available to network companies under the next RIIO-T2 price control period from 2021-2026.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Local electricity pricing could save consumers £2.1bn annually
lead: ​Introducing local electricity pricing could reduce electricity system costs by as much as £2.1 billion a year from 2030 onwards, according to a new report.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: EDF furthers battery storage optimisation portfolio with SWGT deal
lead: ​Battery storage asset manager SWGT has signed a long-term optimisation agreement with EDF for its 30MW utility-scale battery.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Power prices spike to £720/MWh as low winds continue to stretch grid
lead: ​It has been a tumultuous weekend for energy prices in the UK, with an unprecedented day-ahead clearing price for a Sunday of £350/MWh.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: ScottishPower takes on collapsed supplier Yorkshire Energy’s customers
lead: ​ScottishPower has taken on collapsed Yorkshire Energy’s 74,000 domestic customers as well as a small number of non-domestic customers.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Roisin Quinn steps down as National Grid ESO shakes up top team
lead: ​Roisin Quinn has stepped down as head of national control to pursue a new role in the National Grid Group, with Isabelle Haigh to takeover from spring 2021.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Uniper moves ahead in National Grid ESO inertia contract with Siemens deal
lead: ​Uniper has appointed Siemens Energy to deliver grid stabilisation as part of its inertia contract with National Grid ESO.
author: Alice Grundy

title: GRIDSERVE celebrates 'major milestone' as UK’s first Electric Forecourt opens for business
lead: GRIDSERVE’s Electric Forecourt near Braintree in Essex has officially opened for business.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: BM prices skyrocket to £1,000/MWh as cold weather and low wind bites
lead: ​Prices in the Balancing Mechanism hit £1,000/MWh last night (03 December) with two CCGT offers accepted at the price.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Nottinghamshire to pilot EV charging point for electric buses
lead: ​Nottinghamshire County Council has partnered with energy storage start-up Cheesecake Energy Ltd (CEL) to pilot EV charging points for a new fleet of electric buses.
author: Edith Hancock
